## Sleep Deprivation and Cognitive Performance

## Goals

-   Understand the effects of sleep deprivation (hours of sleep, sleep quality, daytime sleep) on cognitive performance (attention, working memory, reaction speed, emotion regulation)

### Read Data

```{r read_data}
library(readr)

df <- read_csv("sleep_deprivation_dataset_detailed.csv")
head(df)
```

### Data Structure

```{r data_structure}
str(df)
```

### Summary Statistics

```{r summary}
summary(df)
```

```{r unique_gender}
cat("Unique values of df$Gender:", unique(df$Gender), "\n")
cat("Unique values of df$Caffeine_Intake", sort(unique(df$Caffeine_Intake)), "\n")
```

Note:

-   `Caffeine_Intake`, `Sleep_Quality_Score`, `Daytime_Sleepiness`, `Physical_Activity_Level`, and `Stress_Level` are discrete variables.

-   `Gender` is a binary variable.
